The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a broad, spreading canopy and elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, often clustered in axillary or terminal inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. Due to its economic importance and slow growth rate, Moutabea dibotrya is considered a threatened species in many parts of its native range.
